variants.Description in input context: This variant, c.2187A>G (p.I729V), is predicted to disrupt protein folding and trafficking.

Material used.Material Name: Fibroblast cell lines from ALS patients carrying SYNJ c.2187A>G variant
Material used.Description: Fibroblasts were cultured and subjected to co-immunoprecipitation followed by mass spectrometry to determine protein interactions.

Readout description.Result Description: Co-immunoprecipitation revealed a significant reduction in the interaction between SYNJ and SNARE proteins in cells carrying the variant.  Mass spectrometry analysis confirmed increased aggregation of the mutant SYNJ protein.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent fibroblast lines from unrelated patients carrying the variant were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each IP was performed in duplicate to minimize error.

Basic positive control.Description: Fibroblasts from healthy donors were used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Control immunoprecipitation without antibody was performed to assess background signal.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare protein interaction levels between variant and control samples.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein interaction level > 0.8 relative to control.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein interaction level < 0.5 relative to control.
